<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Usually, we just want to insert the copy before the first terminator</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction. However, for the edge going to a landing pad, we must insert</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the copy before the call/invoke instruction. Similarly for an INLINEASM&#95;BR</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// going to an indirect target. This is similar to SplitKit.cpp&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// computeLastInsertPoint, and similarly assumes that there cannot be multiple</span></CodeLine>
